00084 /**
00085  * \ingroup SimpleDataObjects
00086  * \brief Initialize a sorted int array.
00087  *
00088  * \description
00089  *
00090  *    The sia must already have been allocated
00091  *
00092  * \modifications
00093  *    - 06/06/06 ACG Created.
00094  */
00095 FC_ReturnCode fc_initSortedIntArray(
00096   FC_SortedIntArray *sia /**< input/output - sortedIntArray */
00097 )
00098 {
00099   if (sia == NULL) {
00100     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
00101     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
00102   }
00103 
00104   fc_printfLogMessage("Initing sorted int array");
00105 
00106   sia->numVal     = 0;
00107   sia->maxNumVal  = 0;
00108   sia->vals       = NULL;
00109   sia->nextTicket = 0;
00110   sia->tickets    = NULL;
00111   
00112   return FC_SUCCESS;
00113 }
00114 
00115 /**
00116  * \ingroup SimpleDataObjects
00117  * \brief Check to see if a sorted int array is valid.
00118  *
00119  * \description
00120  *
00121  *    Checks that the sorted int array has "sane" values. Returns
00122  *    1 if the sorted array looks valid and 0 if it does not.
00123  *
00124  * \modifications
00125  *    - 2006/06/06 ACG Created.
00126  */
00127 int fc_isSortedIntArrayValid(
00128   FC_SortedIntArray *sia /**< input - sortedIntArray */
00129 )
00130 {
00131   if ((!sia) || 
00132       (sia->numVal < 0)                                                                 || 
00133       (sia->maxNumVal < 0)                                                              ||
00134       (sia->numVal > sia->maxNumVal)                                                    ||
00135       ((sia->maxNumVal == 0) && ((sia->vals != NULL)|| (sia->tickets!=NULL))) ||
00136       ((sia->maxNumVal  > 0) && ((sia->vals == NULL)|| (sia->tickets==NULL)))   ) {
00137     return 0;
00138   }
00139   else
00140     return 1;
00141 }
00142 
00143 /**
00144  * \ingroup SimpleDataObjects
00145  * \brief Copy (deep copy) a sorted int array.
00146  *
00147  * \description
00148  *
00149  *    The destination sia must already have been allocated but does not have to
00150  *    be initialized. This peforms a deep copy (i.e. internal data is copied).
00151  *
00152  * \modifications
00153  *    - 2006/08/04 WSD Created.
00154  *    - 2008/05/02 CDU Updated to support getting unsorted vals back
00155  */
00156 FC_ReturnCode fc_copySortedIntArray(
00157   FC_SortedIntArray *sia_src, /**< input - sortedIntArray to copy*/
00158   FC_SortedIntArray *sia_dest /**< output - new sortedIntArray */
00159 )
00160 {
00161   if (!fc_isSortedIntArrayValid(sia_src) || !sia_dest) {
00162     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
00163     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
00164   }
00165 
00166   fc_printfLogMessage("Copying sorted int array");
00167 
00168   sia_dest->numVal    = sia_src->numVal;
00169   sia_dest->maxNumVal = sia_src->numVal;
00170   sia_dest->nextTicket = sia_src->nextTicket;
00171   if (sia_src->numVal > 0) {
00172     sia_dest->vals              = malloc(sia_src->numVal*sizeof(int));
00173     sia_dest->tickets = malloc(sia_src->numVal*sizeof(unsigned int));
00174     if((sia_dest->vals == NULL) ||
00175        (sia_dest->tickets == NULL)){
00176       fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
00177       return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
00178     }
00179     memcpy(sia_dest->vals, sia_src->vals, sia_src->numVal*sizeof(int));
00180     memcpy(sia_dest->tickets, sia_src->tickets, sia_src->numVal*sizeof(unsigned int));
00181 
00182   }
00183   else {
00184     sia_dest->vals    = NULL;
00185     sia_dest->tickets = NULL;
00186   }
00187   
00188   return FC_SUCCESS;
00189 }
00190 
00191 /**
00192  * \ingroup SimpleDataObjects
00193  * \brief Get number of values in sorted int array.
00194  *
00195  * \modifications
00196  *    - 2006/08/03 WSD created.
00197  */
00198 FC_ReturnCode fc_getSortedIntArrayNumValue(
00199   FC_SortedIntArray *sia,  /**< input - sortedIntArray */
00200   int* numValue            /**< output - number of values */
00201 ){
00202   // default returns
00203   if (numValue)
00204     *numValue = -1;
00205 
00206   // check arguments
00207   if (!fc_isSortedIntArrayValid(sia) || !numValue) {
00208     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
00209     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
00210   }
00211 
00212   // do it
00213   *numValue = sia->numVal;
00214 
00215   return FC_SUCCESS;
00216 }
00217 
00218 /**
00219  * \ingroup SimpleDataObjects
00220  * \brief Get a copy of the values stored in the sorted int array.
00221  *
00222  * \description
00223  *
00224  *    Returns a copy of the values stores in the sorted int array.  The caller
00225  *    is responsible for freeing the return array.  If you know you never want
00226  *    to use the current values of the sorted int array again, you can instead
00227  *    convert by using \ref fc_convertSortedIntArrayToIntArray.
00228  *
00229  * \modifications
00230  *    - 2006/08/04 WSD created.
00231  */
00232 FC_ReturnCode fc_getSortedIntArrayValues(
00233   FC_SortedIntArray *sia,  /**< input - sortedIntArray */
00234   int* numValue,           /**< output - number of values */
00235   int** values             /**< output - values (needs to be freed) */
00236 ){
00237   // default returns
00238   if (numValue)
00239     *numValue = -1;
00240   if (values)
00241     *values = NULL;
00242 
00243   // check arguments
00244   if (!fc_isSortedIntArrayValid(sia) || !numValue || !values) {
00245     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
00246     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
00247   }
00248 
00249   // easy case - no valus
00250   if (sia->numVal == 0) {
00251     *numValue = 0;
00252     *values = NULL;
00253     return FC_SUCCESS;
00254   }
00255 
00256   // do it
00257   *values = malloc(sia->numVal*sizeof(int));
00258   if (!(*values)) {
00259     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
00260     return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
00261   }
00262   *numValue = sia->numVal;
00263   memcpy(*values, sia->vals, sia->numVal*sizeof(int));
00264 
00265   return FC_SUCCESS;
00266 }
00267 
00268 
00269 int _fc_qsortCmpInt(const void *a, const void *b){
00270   if( *((const int *)a) < *((const int *)b) ) return -1;
00271   if( *((const int *)a) > *((const int *)b) ) return  1;
00272   return 0;      
00273 }
00274 
00275 
00276 /**
00277  * \ingroup SimpleDataObjects
00278  * \brief Get a copy of the values stored in the sorted array, orderd in the way they were inserted
00279  *
00280  * \description
00281  *
00282  *    Returns a copy of the values stores in the sorted int array, ordered in the
00283  *    way they were inserted. This allows a sortedIntArray to be used as a
00284  *    list where ordering is significant.  The caller
00285  *    is responsible for freeing the return array.  If you know you never want
00286  *    to use the current values of the sorted int array again, you can instead
00287  *    convert by using \ref fc_convertSortedIntArrayToIntArray. If you don't
00288  *    care about order, \ref fc_getSortedIntArrayValues is faster. 
00289  *
00290  * \modifications
00291  *    - 2008/05/02 CDU created.
00292  */
00293 FC_ReturnCode fc_getSortedIntArrayValuesInInsertOrder(
00294 
00295   FC_SortedIntArray *sia,  /**< input - sortedIntArray */
00296   int* numValue,           /**< output - number of values */
00297   int** values             /**< output - values (needs to be freed) */
00298 ){
00299   
00300   int  i;
00301   int *tmp;
00302   
00303 
00304   // default returns
00305   if (numValue)
00306     *numValue = -1;
00307   if (values)
00308     *values = NULL;
00309 
00310   // check arguments
00311   if (!fc_isSortedIntArrayValid(sia) || !numValue || !values) {
00312     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
00313     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
00314   }
00315 
00316   // easy case - no valus
00317   if (sia->numVal == 0) {
00318     *numValue = 0;
00319     *values = NULL;
00320     return FC_SUCCESS;
00321   }
00322 
00323   // do it
00324   *values = malloc(sia->numVal*sizeof(int));
00325   if (!(*values)) {
00326     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
00327     return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
00328   }
00329   *numValue = sia->numVal;
00330 
00331 
00332   //Need to resort the values by their insert id. We can do this by
00333   //packing both the insert time and val together and passing on
00334   //to quicksort. Quicksort is given an integer comparison function
00335   //and a stride of 2 to make this work. After everything, we
00336   //unpack the results
00337   tmp = malloc(sia->numVal * 2 * sizeof(int));
00338   for(i=0; i<sia->numVal; i++){
00339     tmp[2*i+0] = sia->tickets[i];
00340     tmp[2*i+1] = sia->vals[i];
00341   }
00342   qsort((void *) tmp, sia->numVal, 2*sizeof(int), _fc_qsortCmpInt );
00343   
00344   for(i=0; i<sia->numVal; i++)
00345     (*values)[i] = tmp[2*i+1]; //Grab vals
00346 
00347   free(tmp);
00348 
00349   return FC_SUCCESS;
00350 }
00351                                    
00352 
00353 /**
00354  * \ingroup SimpleDataObjects
00355  * \brief Query for int in sorted int array.
00356  *
00357  * \description
00358  *
00359  *    Returns 1 if the int is in the array, 0 if it is not, and an
00360  *    FC_ReturnCode if an error occurs.
00361  *
00362  * \modifications
00363  *    - 06/06/06 ACG Created.
00364  *    - 07/13/06 WSD Separated binary search into it's own routine.
00365  *      Separated lookupInt into two seperate add and query functions.
00366  */
00367 int fc_isIntInSortedIntArray(
00368   FC_SortedIntArray *sia, /**< input - sortedIntArray */
00369   int ix                  /**< input - int to look for */
00370 ){
00371   FC_ReturnCode rc;
00372   int foundInt, idx;
00373 
00374   // this call also checks args
00375   rc = _fc_lookupIntInSortedIntArray(sia, ix, &foundInt, &idx);
00376   if (rc < 0)
00377     return rc;
00378 
00379   return foundInt;
00380 }
00381 
00382 /**
00383  * \ingroup SimpleDataObjects
00384  * \brief Add an int to a sorted int array.
00385  *
00386  * \description
00387  *
00388  *    Add an int to a sorted int array. Returns 1 if the int is added.
00389  *    Returns 0 if the int was already there. Returns an FC_ReturnCode
00390  *    if there is an error.
00391  *
00392  * \modifications
00393  *    - 06/06/06 ACG Created.
00394  *    - 07/13/06 WSD Separated binary search into it's own routine.
00395  *      Separated lookupInt into two seperate add and query functions.
00396  */
00397 int fc_addIntToSortedIntArray(
00398   FC_SortedIntArray *sia, /**< input/output - sortedIntArray */
00399   int ix                  /**< input - int to add */
00400 ){
00401   FC_ReturnCode rc;
00402   int foundInt, idx;
00403 
00404   // this call also checks args
00405   rc = _fc_lookupIntInSortedIntArray(sia, ix, &foundInt, &idx);
00406   if (rc < 0)
00407     return rc;
00408 
00409   // early return
00410   if (foundInt == 1)
00411     return 0;
00412 
00413   // do it (this routine allocates memory if needed)
00414   rc = _fc_addEntryToSortedIntArray(sia, idx, ix);
00415   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
00416     return rc;
00417   else
00418     return 1;
00419 }
00420 
00421 /**
00422  * \ingroup SimpleDataObjects
00423  * \brief Add an array of ints to a sorted int array.
00424  *
00425  * \description
00426  *
00427  *    Add an array of ints to a sorted int array. Returns the total number
00428  *    of ints added (if all ints already existed, would return zero).
00429  *    Returns an FC_ReturnCode if there is an error.
00430  *
00431  *    The extra flag, isSorted, is for performance. A value of 1
00432  *    means the incoming ints are already sorted (0 means they
00433  *    may not be).
00434  *
00435  *    The incoming int array can have repeated values.
00436  *
00437  * \modifications
00438  *    - 2006/07/13 WSD Created.
00439  *    - 2008/05/02 CDU Updated to support getting unsorted vals back
00440  */
00441 int fc_addIntArrayToSortedIntArray(
00442   FC_SortedIntArray *sia, /**< input/output - sortedIntArray */
00443   int num,                /**< input - number of ints to add */
00444   int* array,             /**< input - the ints to add */
00445   int isSorted            /**< input - flag, 1 = incoming ints are sorted */
00446 ){
00447   int i, j;
00448   //int *sortedArray;
00449   int numAdded;
00450   int newNum, newMaxNum, *newVals, *newTickets;
00451   int spacing;
00452   int *combined;
00453 
00454   // check input
00455   if (!fc_isSortedIntArrayValid(sia) || num < 0 || (num > 0 && array == NULL)) {
00456     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
00457     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
00458   }
00459 
00460   // early return - empty array
00461   if (num == 0)
00462     return 0;
00463   
00464   // sort, if necessary
00465   if (isSorted) {
00466     //Since this is already sorted, just use it. We have to use a spacing
00467     //of one since "combined" isn't really a combination- it's just a
00468     //pointer to vals.
00469     spacing = 1;
00470     combined = array;
00471   }else {
00472     
00473     //Create a combined block where val and insert id are interleaved
00474     spacing = 2;
00475     combined = (int *)malloc(num*2*sizeof(int));
00476     if(!combined){
00477       fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
00478       return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
00479     }
00480     for(i=0;i<num;i++){
00481       combined[i*2+0] = array[i]; //value that gets looked at
00482       combined[i*2+1] = i;
00483     }
00484     qsort((void *) combined, num, 2*sizeof(int), _fc_qsortCmpInt );
00485 
00486   }
00487 
00488   // make space for result (will replace current sia->vals)
00489   newMaxNum = sia->numVal + num;
00490   newVals = (int*)malloc(newMaxNum*sizeof(int));
00491   newTickets = (int *)malloc(newMaxNum*sizeof(int));
00492   if ((newVals == NULL) || (newTickets==NULL)){
00493     free(newVals);
00494     free(newTickets);
00495     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
00496     return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
00497   }
00498 
00499   // make new vals
00500   numAdded = 0;
00501   newNum = 0;
00502   i = j = 0;
00503   while (i < sia->numVal && j < num) {
00504     if (sia->vals[i] < combined[j*spacing]) {
00505       //Original array smaller
00506       newVals[newNum]    = sia->vals[i];
00507       newTickets[newNum] = sia->tickets[i];
00508       newNum++;
00509       i++;
00510     }
00511     else if (combined[j*spacing] < sia->vals[i]) {
00512       //New val is smaller
00513       newVals[newNum] = combined[j*spacing];
00514       newTickets[newNum] = sia->nextTicket;          //All new vals start at current ticket
00515       newTickets[newNum] += (isSorted) ? j : combined[j*2+1]; //Plus their insert id
00516       newNum++;
00517       numAdded++;
00518       j++;
00519       while ((j < num) && (combined[j*spacing] == combined[(j-1)*spacing])) // skip duplicates
00520      j++;
00521     }
00522     else {
00523       newVals[newNum] = sia->vals[i];
00524       newTickets[newNum] = sia->tickets[i];
00525       newNum++;
00526       i++;
00527       j++;
00528       while ((j < num) && (combined[j*spacing] == combined[(j-1)*spacing])) // skip duplicates
00529      j++;
00530     }
00531   }
00532   if (i < sia->numVal) {
00533     //Leftovers in original array
00534     memcpy(&newVals[newNum],    &sia->vals[i],              (sia->numVal-i)*sizeof(int));
00535     memcpy(&newTickets[newNum], &sia->tickets[i], (sia->numVal-i)*sizeof(int));
00536     newNum += sia->numVal-i;
00537   }
00538   else if (j < num) {
00539     //Leftovers in new array
00540     while (j < num) {
00541       newVals[newNum]    = combined[j*spacing];
00542       newTickets[newNum] = sia->nextTicket;          //All new vals start at current ticket
00543       newTickets[newNum] += (isSorted) ? j : combined[j*2+1]; //Plus their insert id
00544       newNum++;
00545       numAdded++;
00546       j++;
00547       while ((j < num) && (combined[j*spacing] == combined[(j-1)*spacing])) // skip duplicates
00548      j++;
00549     }
00550   }
00551 
00552   // swap old vals for new
00553   if (numAdded == 0) {
00554     free(newVals);
00555     free(newTickets);
00556   }
00557   else {
00558     assert(sia->nextTicket+num > sia->nextTicket); //Check for overflow
00559 
00560     free(sia->vals);
00561     free(sia->tickets);
00562     sia->numVal = newNum;
00563     sia->maxNumVal = newMaxNum;
00564     sia->vals = newVals;
00565     sia->tickets = newTickets;
00566     sia->nextTicket += num; //must do all of array, even if some unused
00567   }
00568 
00569   // cleanup after sort, if necessary
00570   if (!isSorted)
00571     free(combined);
00572 
00573   return numAdded;
00574 }
00575 
00576 /**
00577  * \ingroup SimpleDataObjects
00578  * \brief Remove an int from a sorted int array.
00579  *
00580  * \description
00581  *
00582  *    Returns 1 if the int was found and deleted, returns 0 if the int was not
00583  *    in the array, and returns an error code if something went wrong. (Note:
00584  *    the total size of the array does not change, call \ref
00585  *    fc_squeezeSortedIntArray() to save space).
00586  *
00587  * \modifications
00588  *    - 06/06/06 ACG Created.
00589  *    - 07/13/06 WSD Separated binary search into it's own routine.
00590  */
00591 int fc_deleteIntFromSortedIntArray(
00592   FC_SortedIntArray *sia,  /**< input/output - sortedIntArray */
00593   int ix                   /**< input - int to lookup */
00594 ){
00595   FC_ReturnCode rc;
00596   int foundInt, idx;
00597 
00598   // This call also checks sia
00599   rc = _fc_lookupIntInSortedIntArray(sia, ix, &foundInt, &idx);
00600   if (rc < 0)
00601     return rc;
00602 
00603   // early return
00604   if (foundInt == 0)
00605     return 0;
00606 
00607   // do it
00608   rc = _fc_deleteEntryFromSortedIntArray(sia, idx);
00609   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
00610     return rc;
00611   else
00612     return 1;
00613 }
00614 
00615 /**
00616  * \ingroup SimpleDataObjects
00617  * \brief Get first value in the sorted int array (WARNING: does not check for
00618  *        empty array)
00619  *
00620  * \description
00621  *
00622  *    Returns the first value in a non empty sorted int array. Do not use
00623  *    this funciton on empty sorted int arrays. Use \ref
00624  *    fc_getSortedIntArrayNumValue to determine if an array has values.
00625  *    To remove the front value, use \ref fc_popSortedIntArrayFront.
00626  *
00627  *    You can also manipulate the back of a sorted int array; see also 
00628  *    \ref fc_getSortedIntArrayBack and fc_popSortedIntArrayBack.
00629  *
00630  * \modifications
00631  *    - 08/03/06 WSD Created.
00632  */
00633 int fc_getSortedIntArrayFront(
00634   FC_SortedIntArray *sia, /**< input - sortedIntArray */
00635   int* value              /**< input - first value in the array */
00636 ){
00637   // default return
00638   if (value)
00639     *value = -1;
00640   
00641   // check arguments
00642   if (!fc_isSortedIntArrayValid(sia)) {
00643     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
00644     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
00645   }
00646 
00647   // do it
00648   if (sia->numVal > 0) {
00649     *value = sia->vals[0];
00650   }
00651   else {
00652     fc_printfWarningMessage("Getting the front of an empty sorted int array");
00653   }
00654 
00655   return FC_SUCCESS;
00656 }
00657 
00658 /**
00659  * \ingroup SimpleDataObjects
00660  * \brief Get last value in the sorted int array (WARNING: does not check for
00661  *        empty array)
00662  *
00663  * \description
00664  *
00665  *    Returns the last value in a non empty sorted int array. Do not use
00666  *    this funciton on empty sorted int arrays. Use \ref
00667  *    fc_getSortedIntArrayNumValue to determine if an array has values.
00668  *    To remove the back value, use \ref fc_popSortedIntArrayBack.
00669  *
00670  *    You can also manipulate the front of a sorted int array; see also 
00671  *    \ref fc_getSortedIntArrayFront and fc_popSortedIntArrayFront.
00672  *
00673  * \modifications
00674  *    - 08/03/06 WSD Created.
00675  */
00676 int fc_getSortedIntArrayBack(
00677   FC_SortedIntArray *sia, /**< input - sortedIntArray */
00678   int* value              /**< input - last value in the array */
00679 ){
00680   // default return
00681   if (value)
00682     *value = -1;
00683   
00684   // check arguments
00685   if (!fc_isSortedIntArrayValid(sia)) {
00686     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
00687     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
00688   }
00689 
00690   // do it
00691   if (sia->numVal > 0) {
00692     *value = sia->vals[sia->numVal-1];
00693   }
00694   else {
00695     fc_printfWarningMessage("Getting the front of an empty sorted int array");
00696   }
00697 
00698   return FC_SUCCESS;
00699 }
00700 
00701 /**
00702  * \ingroup SimpleDataObjects
00703  * \brief Delete the first value in a sorted int array.
00704  *
00705  * \description
00706  *
00707  *    Delete the first value in a sorted int array. The return value
00708  *    is an FC_ReturnCode if there is an error, 0 if the array is
00709  *    empty, or 1 if the value has been deleted.
00710  *
00711  *    If you want to know the value of the front, before popping you must
00712  *    call \ref fc_getSortedIntArrayFront.
00713  *
00714  *    You can also manipulate the back of a sorted int array; see also 
00715  *    \ref fc_getSortedIntArrayBack and fc_popSortedIntArrayBack.
00716  *
00717  * \modifications
00718  *    - 08/03/06 WSD Created.
00719  *    - 2008/05/02 CDU Updated to support getting unsorted vals back
00720  */
00721 int fc_popSortedIntArrayFront(
00722   FC_SortedIntArray *sia /**< input/output - sortedIntArray */
00723 ){
00724   // check arguments
00725   if (!fc_isSortedIntArrayValid(sia)) {
00726     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
00727     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
00728   }
00729 
00730   // do it (do minimum amt of work)
00731   if (sia->numVal > 0) {
00732     sia->numVal--;
00733     if (sia->numVal > 0) {
00734       memmove(sia->vals,    sia->vals+1,    sia->numVal*sizeof(int));
00735       memmove(sia->tickets, sia->tickets+1, sia->numVal*sizeof(int));
00736     }
00737     return 1;
00738   }
00739   else {
00740     return 0;
00741   }
00742 }
00743 
00744 /**
00745  * \ingroup SimpleDataObjects
00746  * \brief Delete the last value in a sorted int array.
00747  *
00748  * \description
00749  *
00750  *    Delete the last value in a sorted int array. The return value
00751  *    is an FC_ReturnCode if there is an error, 0 if the array is
00752  *    empty, or 1 if the value has been deleted.
00753  *
00754  *    If you want to know the value of the back, before popping you must
00755  *    call \ref fc_getSortedIntArrayBack.
00756  *
00757  *    You can also manipulate the front of a sorted int array; see also 
00758  *    \ref fc_getSortedIntArrayFront and fc_popSortedIntArrayFront.
00759  *
00760  * \modifications
00761  *    - 08/03/06 WSD Created.
00762  */
00763 int fc_popSortedIntArrayBack(
00764   FC_SortedIntArray *sia /**< input/output - sortedIntArray */
00765 ){
00766   // check arguments
00767   if (!fc_isSortedIntArrayValid(sia)) {
00768     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
00769     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
00770   }
00771 
00772   // do it (do minimum amt of work)
00773   if (sia->numVal > 0) {
00774     sia->numVal--;
00775     return 1;
00776   }
00777   else {
00778     return 0;
00779   }
00780 }
00781 
00782 /**
00783  * \ingroup SimpleDataObjects
00784  * \brief Realloc the sorted int array so it has no extra space.
00785  *
00786  * \modifications
00787  *    - 06/06/06 ACG Created.
00788  */
00789 FC_ReturnCode fc_squeezeSortedIntArray(
00790   FC_SortedIntArray *sia /**< input - sortedIntArray */
00791 ){
00792   int *temp1, *temp2;
00793 
00794   // check args
00795   if (!fc_isSortedIntArrayValid(sia)){
00796     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
00797     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
00798   }
00799 
00800   // early return
00801   if (sia->numVal == sia->maxNumVal) // already compressed
00802     return FC_SUCCESS;
00803 
00804   // special case - empty
00805   if (sia->numVal == 0) {
00806     free(sia->vals);
00807     free(sia->tickets);
00808     sia->maxNumVal = 0;
00809     sia->vals = NULL;
00810     sia->tickets = NULL;
00811     sia->nextTicket = 0;
00812     return FC_SUCCESS;
00813   }
00814 
00815   // do it
00816   temp1 = (int*)realloc(sia->vals,    (sia->numVal)*sizeof(int));
00817   temp2 = (int*)realloc(sia->tickets, (sia->numVal)*sizeof(int));
00818 
00819   if((temp1 == NULL)||(temp2 == NULL)){
00820     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
00821     return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
00822   }
00823 
00824   sia->maxNumVal = sia->numVal;
00825   sia->vals      = temp1;
00826   sia->tickets   = temp2;
00827 
00828 
00829   return FC_SUCCESS;
00830 }
00831 
00832 /**
00833  * \ingroup SimpleDataObjects
00834  * \brief Free the sorted int array's values.
00835  *
00836  * \description
00837  *
00838  *    This routine frees the internals of a sorted int array, but not
00839  *    the sia itself. The user must dealloc the sia itself, unless it
00840  *    was automatically allocated.
00841  *
00842  * \modifications
00843  *    - 2006/06/06 ACG Created.
00844  *    - 2008/05/02 CDU Updated to support getting unsorted vals back
00845  */
00846 void fc_freeSortedIntArray(
00847   FC_SortedIntArray *sia /**< input/output - sortedIntArray */
00848 ){
00849 
00850   if (!fc_isSortedIntArrayValid(sia)){
00851     return; 
00852   }
00853 
00854   if (sia->vals){
00855     free(sia->vals);
00856     free(sia->tickets);
00857     sia->numVal = 0;
00858     sia->maxNumVal = 0;
00859     sia->nextTicket = 0;
00860     sia->vals = NULL;
00861     sia->tickets = NULL;
00862   }
00863 }
00864 
00865 /**
00866  * \ingroup SimpleDataObjects
00867  * \brief prints the sortedint array
00868  *
00869  * \description
00870  *
00871  *    Prints the contents of a sorted int array.
00872  *
00873  * \modifications
00874  *    - 06/06/06 ACG Created.
00875  *    - 06/07/06 ACG takes ptr to array as parameter
00876  */
00877 FC_ReturnCode fc_printSortedIntArray(
00878   FC_SortedIntArray *sia /**< input - sortedIntArray */
00879 ){
00880   int i;
00881 
00882   // check args
00883   if (!fc_isSortedIntArrayValid(sia)){
00884     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
00885     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
00886   }
00887 
00888   printf("Sorted Int Array:\n");
00889   printf("    numVal = %d\n", sia->numVal);
00890   printf("    maxNumVal = %d\n", sia->maxNumVal);
00891   printf("    vals =");
00892   if (sia->numVal == 0){
00893     printf(" (empty)\n");
00894   }
00895   else {
00896     for (i = 0; i < sia->numVal; i++){
00897       printf(" %d",sia->vals[i]);
00898     }
00899     printf("\n");
00900   }
00901   printf("    insert tickets =");
00902   if (sia->numVal == 0){
00903     printf(" (empty)\n");
00904   }
00905   else {
00906     for (i = 0; i < sia->numVal; i++){
00907       printf(" %d",sia->tickets[i]);
00908     }
00909     printf("\n");
00910   }
00911 
00912 
00913   fflush(NULL);
00914   
00915   return FC_SUCCESS;
00916 }
00917 
00918 //@}
00919 
00920 /** 
00921  * \name Sorted Blob Array Routines
00922  *
00923  * Sorted, exclusive, self-exanding array of pointers to data blobs. The array
00924  * is implemented as an array of pointers (void*) to the objects of interest
00925  * and do not manage the blobs themselves.  The user must also provide a
00926  * function that compares blobs and returns -1 if the first blob is "less than"
00927  * the 2nd, 0 if the blobs are equivalent, and 1 if the 2nd glob is greater
00928  * than first blob (the same as compare functions for qsort).
00929  */
00930 //-------------------------------
00931 //@{
00932 
00933 /**
00934  * \ingroup SimpleDataObjects
00935  * \brief Initialize a sorted blob array.
00936  *
00937  * \description
00938  *
00939  *    The sba must already have been allocated
00940  *
00941  * \modifications
00942  *    - 08/07/06 WSK Created.
00943  */
00944 FC_ReturnCode fc_initSortedBlobArray(
00945   FC_SortedBlobArray *sba /**< input/output - sortedBlobArray */
00946 )
00947 {
00948   if (sba == NULL){
00949     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
00950     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
00951   }
00952 
00953   fc_printfLogMessage("Initing sorted blob array");
00954 
00955   sba->numBlob = 0;
00956   sba->maxNumBlob = 0;
00957   sba->blobs = NULL;
00958   
00959   return FC_SUCCESS;
00960 }
00961 
00962 /**
00963  * \ingroup SimpleDataObjects
00964  * \brief Check to see if a sorted blob array is valid.
00965  *
00966  * \description
00967  *
00968  *    Checks that the sorted blob array has "sane" values. Returns
00969  *    1 if the sorted array looks valid and 0 if it does not.
00970  *
00971  * \modifications
00972  *    - 06/06/06 ACG Created.
00973  */
00974 int fc_isSortedBlobArrayValid(
00975   FC_SortedBlobArray *sba /**< input - sortedBlobArray */
00976 )
00977 {
00978   if (!sba || sba->numBlob < 0 || sba->maxNumBlob < 0 ||
00979       sba->numBlob > sba->maxNumBlob ||
00980       (sba->maxNumBlob == 0 && sba->blobs != NULL) ||
00981       (sba->maxNumBlob > 0 && sba->blobs == NULL)) {
00982     return 0;
00983   }
00984   else
00985     return 1;
00986 }
00987 
00988 /**
00989  * \ingroup SimpleDataObjects
00990  * \brief Get number of blobs in sorted blob array.
00991  *
00992  * \modifications
00993  *    - 08/08/06 WSD created.
00994  */
00995 FC_ReturnCode fc_getSortedBlobArrayNumBlob(
00996   FC_SortedBlobArray *sba,  /**< input - sortedBlobArray */
00997   int* numBlob              /**< output - number of blobs */
00998 ){
00999   // default returns
01000   if (numBlob)
01001     *numBlob = -1;
01002 
01003   // check arguments
01004   if (!fc_isSortedBlobArrayValid(sba) || !numBlob) {
01005     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
01006     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
01007   }
01008 
01009   // do it
01010   *numBlob = sba->numBlob;
01011 
01012   return FC_SUCCESS;
01013 }
01014 
01015 /**
01016  * \ingroup SimpleDataObjects
01017  * \brief Get a copy of the blob locations stored in the sorted blob array.
01018  *
01019  * \description
01020  *
01021  *    Returns a copy of the blob locations storee in the sorted blob array.
01022  *    The caller is responsible for freeing the returned array.
01023  *
01024  * \modifications
01025  *    - 08/08/06 WSD created.
01026  */
01027 FC_ReturnCode fc_getSortedBlobArrayBlobs(
01028   FC_SortedBlobArray *sba,  /**< input - sortedBlobArray */
01029   int* numBlob,             /**< output - number of values */
01030   void*** blobs             /**< output - blob locations (needs to be freed) */
01031 ){
01032   // default returns
01033   if (numBlob)
01034     *numBlob = -1;
01035   if (blobs)
01036     *blobs = NULL;
01037 
01038   // check arguments
01039   if (!fc_isSortedBlobArrayValid(sba) || !numBlob || !blobs) {
01040     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
01041     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
01042   }
01043 
01044   // easy case - no valus
01045   if (sba->numBlob == 0) {
01046     *numBlob = 0;
01047     *blobs = NULL;
01048     return FC_SUCCESS;
01049   }
01050 
01051   // do it
01052   *blobs = malloc(sba->numBlob*sizeof(void*));
01053   if (!(*blobs)) {
01054     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
01055     return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
01056   }
01057   *numBlob = sba->numBlob;
01058   memcpy(*blobs, sba->blobs, sba->numBlob*sizeof(void*));
01059 
01060   return FC_SUCCESS;
01061 }
01062 
01063 /**
01064  * \ingroup SimpleDataObjects
01065  * \brief Query for blob in sorted blob array.
01066  *
01067  * \description
01068  *
01069  *    Returns 1 if the blob is in the array, 0 if it is not, and an
01070  *    FC_ReturnCode if an error occurs. Also returns pointer to
01071  *    the blob already in the array if requested (pass NULL if you
01072  *    don't want it).
01073  *
01074  * \modifications
01075  *    - 08/08/2006 WSD Created.
01076  */
01077 int fc_isBlobInSortedBlobArray(
01078   FC_SortedBlobArray *sba, /**< input - sortedBlobArray */
01079   void* blob,              /**< input - blob to look for */
01080   int blobCmp(const void*, const void*), /**< input - the blob comparison 
01081                              function */
01082   void** foundBlob         /**< output - (optional) the found blob */
01083 ){
01084   FC_ReturnCode rc;
01085   int foundInt, idx;
01086 
01087   // default return
01088   if (foundBlob)
01089     *foundBlob = NULL;
01090 
01091   // this call also checks args
01092   rc = _fc_lookupBlobInSortedBlobArray(sba, blob, blobCmp, &foundInt, &idx);
01093   if (rc < 0)
01094     return rc;
01095 
01096   if (foundInt && foundBlob)
01097     *foundBlob = sba->blobs[idx];
01098 
01099   return foundInt;
01100 }
01101 
01102 /**
01103  * \ingroup SimpleDataObjects
01104  * \brief Add a blob to a sorted blob array.
01105  *
01106  * \description
01107  *
01108  *    Add a blob to a sorted blob array. Returns 1 if the blob is added.
01109  *    Returns 0 if the blob was already there. Returns an FC_ReturnCode
01110  *    if there is an error.
01111  *
01112  * \modifications
01113  *    - 08/08/2006 WSD Created.
01114  */
01115 int fc_addBlobToSortedBlobArray(
01116   FC_SortedBlobArray *sba, /**< input/output - sortedBlobArray */
01117   void* blob,              /**< input - blob to add */
01118   int blobCmp(const void*, const void*) /**< input - the blob comparison 
01119                              function */
01120 ){
01121   FC_ReturnCode rc;
01122   int foundInt, idx;
01123 
01124   // this call also checks args
01125   rc = _fc_lookupBlobInSortedBlobArray(sba, blob, blobCmp, &foundInt, &idx);
01126   if (rc < 0)
01127     return rc;
01128 
01129   // early return
01130   if (foundInt == 1)
01131     return 0;
01132 
01133   // do it (this routine allocates memory if needed)
01134   rc = _fc_addEntryToSortedBlobArray(sba, idx, blob);
01135   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
01136     return rc;
01137   else
01138     return 1;
01139 }
01140 
01141 /**
01142  * \ingroup SimpleDataObjects
01143  * \brief Remove a blob from a sorted blob array.
01144  *
01145  * \description
01146  *
01147  *    Returns 1 if the blob was found and deleted, returns 0 if the blob was not
01148  *    in the array, and returns an error code if something went wrong. (Note:
01149  *    the total size of the array does not change, call \ref
01150  *    fc_squeezeSortedBlobArray() to save space). Also returns pointer to
01151  *    the blob deleted from the array if requested (pass NULL if you
01152  *    don't want it).
01153  *
01154  * \modifications
01155  *    - 08/08/2006 WSD Created.
01156  */
01157 int fc_deleteBlobFromSortedBlobArray(
01158   FC_SortedBlobArray *sba, /**< input/output - sortedBlobArray */
01159   void* blob,              /**< input - blob to delete */
01160   int blobCmp(const void*, const void*), /**< input - the blob comparison 
01161                              function */
01162   void** deletedBlob       /**< output - (optional) the deleted blob */
01163 ){
01164   FC_ReturnCode rc;
01165   int foundInt, idx;
01166 
01167   // default return
01168   if (deletedBlob)
01169     *deletedBlob = NULL;
01170 
01171   // This call also checks sia
01172   rc = _fc_lookupBlobInSortedBlobArray(sba, blob, blobCmp, &foundInt, &idx);
01173   if (rc < 0)
01174     return rc;
01175 
01176   // early return
01177   if (foundInt == 0)
01178     return 0;
01179 
01180   // do it
01181   if (deletedBlob)
01182     *deletedBlob = sba->blobs[idx];
01183   rc = _fc_deleteEntryFromSortedBlobArray(sba, idx);
01184   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
01185     return rc;
01186   else
01187     return 1;
01188 }
01189 
01190 /**
01191  * \ingroup SimpleDataObjects
01192  * \brief Realloc the sorted blob array so it has no extra space.
01193  *
01194  * \modifications
01195  *    - 06/06/06 ACG Created.
01196  */
01197 FC_ReturnCode fc_squeezeSortedBlobArray(
01198   FC_SortedBlobArray *sba /**< input - sortedBlobArray */
01199 ){
01200   void** temp;
01201 
01202   // check args
01203   if (!fc_isSortedBlobArrayValid(sba)){
01204     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
01205     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
01206   }
01207 
01208   // early return
01209   if (sba->numBlob == sba->maxNumBlob) // already compressed
01210     return FC_SUCCESS;
01211 
01212   // special case - empty
01213   if (sba->numBlob == 0) {
01214     free(sba->blobs);
01215     sba->maxNumBlob = 0;
01216     sba->blobs = NULL;
01217     return FC_SUCCESS;
01218   }
01219 
01220   // do it
01221   temp = (void**)realloc(sba->blobs, (sba->numBlob)*sizeof(void*));
01222   if (temp == NULL){
01223     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
01224     return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
01225   }
01226   sba->maxNumBlob = sba->numBlob;
01227   sba->blobs = temp;
01228 
01229   return FC_SUCCESS;
01230 }
01231 
01232 /**
01233  * \ingroup SimpleDataObjects
01234  * \brief Free the sorted blob array's values.
01235  *
01236  * \description
01237  *
01238  *    This routine frees the internals of a sorted blob array, but not
01239  *    the sba itself. The user must dealloc the sba itself, unless it
01240  *    was automatically allocated.
01241  *
01242  * \modifications
01243  *    - 06/06/06 ACG Created.
01244  */
01245 void fc_freeSortedBlobArray(
01246   FC_SortedBlobArray *sba /**< input/output - sortedBlobArray */
01247 ){
01248 
01249   if (!fc_isSortedBlobArrayValid(sba)){
01250     return; 
01251   }
01252 
01253   if (sba->blobs){
01254     free(sba->blobs);
01255     sba->numBlob = 0;
01256     sba->maxNumBlob = 0;
01257     sba->blobs = NULL;
01258   }
01259 }
01260 
01261 //@}
01262 
01263 /** 
01264  * \name Conversion routines
01265  *
01266  * Conversion implies that original data object will be consumed (no longer
01267  * available) in the process.
01268  */
01269 //-------------------------------
01270 //@{
01271 
01272 /**
01273  * \ingroup SimpleDataObjects
01274  * \brief Convert int array (no duplicates) to sorted int array.
01275  *
01276  * \description
01277  *
01278  *    Convert the int array to a sorted int array. The input array is assumed
01279  *    to have no duplicates. If it does, use 
01280  *    \ref fc_addIntArrayToSortedIntArray. For performance, there is a flag 
01281  *    to specify if the array has already been sorted.
01282  *
01283  *    The sorted int array has to already have been allocated. The int array is
01284  *    "destroyed" in that the responsibility for freeing the array is
01285  *    transfered to the sorted int array. 
01286  *
01287  *    WARNING: Do not use this routine on an automatically allocated array
01288  *    (i.e. one declared as int array[8]). Instead use \ref
01289  *    fc_addIntArrayToSortedIntArray().
01290  *
01291  *    NOTE: It was decided not to handle duplicates because this is meant
01292  *    to be a quick conversion.
01293  *
01294  *    NOTE: For speed, insert order is calculated on the sorted version
01295  *    of the array and not the order passed to the function (see above).
01296  *
01297  * \modifications
01298  *    - 2006/08/04 WSD Created.
01299  *    - 2008/05/02 CDU Updated to support getting unsorted vals back
01300  */
01301 int fc_convertIntArrayToSortedIntArray(
01302   int num,                /**< input - number of ints in array */
01303   int* array,             /**< input - the array of ints */
01304   int isSorted,           /**< input - sorted flag, 1 = sorted, 0 = not sorted */
01305   FC_SortedIntArray *sia  /**< input/output - sortedIntArray */
01306 ){
01307   FC_ReturnCode rc;
01308   int i;
01309 
01310   // default return
01311   // ??? init the sia?
01312   
01313   // check arguments
01314   if (num < 0 || (num > 0 && array == NULL) || !sia) {
01315     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
01316     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
01317   }
01318 
01319   // setup sia
01320   rc = fc_initSortedIntArray(sia);
01321   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
01322     return rc;
01323 
01324   // simple case - no entries
01325   if (num == 0)
01326     return FC_SUCCESS;
01327 
01328   // sort 
01329   if (!isSorted)
01330     fc_sortIntArray(num, array);
01331 
01332   // do it
01333   sia->numVal = num;
01334   sia->maxNumVal = num;
01335   sia->vals = array;
01336   sia->tickets = (int *)malloc(num*sizeof(int));
01337   if(!sia->tickets){
01338     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
01339     return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
01340   }
01341   for(i=0;i<num;i++) 
01342     sia->tickets[i] = i;
01343   sia->nextTicket = num;
01344 
01345   return FC_SUCCESS;
01346 }
01347 
01348 /**
01349  * \ingroup SimpleDataObjects
01350  * \brief Convert sorted int array to array.
01351  *
01352  * \description
01353  *
01354  *    Convert the sorted int array to an int array. The sorted int array
01355  *    will be "destroyed" in that it's contents will be freed (and set back
01356  *    to zero). The sorted int array may still need to be freed it was
01357  *    malloc'd. 
01358  *
01359  * \modifications
01360  *    - 2006/08/04 WSD Created.
01361  *    - 2008/05/02 CDU Updated to support getting unsorted vals back
01362 */
01363 int fc_convertSortedIntArrayToIntArray(
01364   FC_SortedIntArray *sia, /**< input/output - sortedIntArray */
01365   int* num,               /**< input - number of ints in array */
01366   int** array             /**< input - the array of ints */
01367 ){
01368   FC_ReturnCode rc;
01369 
01370   // default return
01371   if (num)
01372     *num = -1;
01373   if (array)
01374     *array = NULL;
01375   
01376   // check arguments
01377   if (!sia || !num || !array) {
01378     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
01379     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
01380   }
01381 
01382   // minimize space usage
01383   rc = fc_squeezeSortedIntArray(sia);
01384   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
01385     return rc;
01386 
01387   // do it
01388   *num = sia->numVal;
01389   *array = sia->vals;
01390   sia->numVal = 0;
01391   sia->maxNumVal = 0;
01392   sia->vals = NULL;
01393   free(sia->tickets);
01394   sia->tickets = NULL;
01395   sia->nextTicket = 0;
01396 
01397   return FC_SUCCESS;
01398 }
01399 
01400 /**
01401  * \ingroup  SimpleDataObjects
01402  * \brief Create an Int Array from a Mask
01403  *
01404  * \description
01405  *       
01406  *    Creates an Int Array from the given mask. The original mask
01407  *    is left untouched. The returned Int Array will be sorted.
01408  *
01409  * \modifications 
01410  *    - 07/01/04 WSK, Created
01411  */
01412 FC_ReturnCode fc_createIntArrayFromMask(
01413   int numMask,    /**< input - number of entries in Mask */
01414   int* mask,       /**< input - mask array */ 
01415   int* numArray,  /**< output - number of entries in returned array */
01416   int **array     /**< output - returned int array, will be sorted */ 
01417 ) {
01418   int i, num;
01419 
01420   // default return
01421   if (numArray)
01422     *numArray = -1;
01423   if (array)
01424     *array = NULL;
01425   
01426   // input checking
01427   if (numMask < 1 || !mask || !numArray || !array) {
01428     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
01429     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
01430   }  
01431 
01432   // log message
01433   fc_printfLogMessage("Creating integer array from mask."); 
01434 
01435   // do it
01436   num = 0;
01437   for (i = 0; i < numMask; i++)
01438     if (mask[i] > 0)
01439       num++;
01440   *numArray = num;
01441   if (num > 0) {
01442     *array = malloc(num*sizeof(int));
01443     if (*array == NULL) {
01444       fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
01445       return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
01446     }
01447     num = 0;
01448     for (i = 0; i < numMask; i++) {
01449       if (mask[i] > 0) {
01450         (*array)[num] = i;
01451         num++;
01452       }
01453     }
01454   }
01455 
01456   return FC_SUCCESS;
01457 }
01458 
01459 /**
01460  * \ingroup  SimpleDataObjects
01461  * \brief Create a Mask from an Int Array
01462  *
01463  * \description
01464  *       
01465  *    Creates a Mask from the given Int Array; the length of the mask
01466  *    must also be provided. The original array is left untouched.
01467  *    numArray = 0 is a valid input that creates a mask with all
01468  *    entries being 0. If any entries of array are outside the range
01469  *    [0, numMask-1], the routine does not create the mask and
01470  *    returns an error.
01471  *
01472  * \modifications 
01473  *    - 07/01/04 WSK, Created
01474  */
01475 FC_ReturnCode fc_createMaskFromIntArray(
01476   int numArray,  /**< input - number of entries in array */
01477   int *array,    /**< input - the array */ 
01478   int numMask,   /**< input - number of entries in Mask */
01479   int** mask     /**< output - the mask array */ 
01480 ) {
01481   int i;
01482 
01483   // default return
01484   if (mask)
01485     *mask = NULL;
01486   
01487   // input checking
01488   if (numArray < 0 || (numArray > 0 && !array) || numMask < 1 || !mask) {
01489     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
01490     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
01491   }  
01492 
01493   // log message
01494   fc_printfLogMessage("Creating mask from integer array."); 
01495 
01496   // do it
01497   *mask = calloc(numMask, sizeof(int));
01498   if (*mask == NULL) {
01499     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
01500     return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
01501   }
01502   
01503   for (i = 0; i < numArray; i++) {
01504     if (array[i] < 0 || array[i] > numMask-1) {
01505       free(*mask);
01506       *mask = NULL;
01507       fc_printfErrorMessage("Input Error: array element has invalid value.");
01508       return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
01509     }
01510     (*mask)[array[i]] = 1;
01511   }
01512 
01513   return FC_SUCCESS;
01514 }
01515 
01516 //@}
01517 
01518 /**
01519  * \ingroup PrivateSimpleDataObjects
01520  * \brief Expand an int array.
01521  *
01522  * \description
01523  *
01524  *    If length == 0, an array of length 1 is generated.
01525  *    If length > 0, then the array length is doubled. If length < 0,
01526  *    an error is generated.
01527  *
01528  * \modifications
01529  *    - 08/07/06 WSD Created.
01530  */
01531 FC_ReturnCode _fc_expandIntArray(
01532   int* length,  /**< input/output - length of the array */
01533   int** array   /**< input/output - the array */
01534 ){
01535   int new_length;
01536   int* new_array;
01537 
01538   // test args (note, array doesn't have to be null if length = 0)
01539   if (!length || *length < 0 || !array) 
01540     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
01541 
01542   // do it
01543   new_length = *length > 0 ? 2*(*length) : 1;
01544   if (*length == 0)  // malloc in case they didn't pass in NULL
01545     new_array = malloc(new_length*sizeof(int));
01546   else 
01547     new_array = realloc(*array, new_length*sizeof(int));
01548   if (!new_array) {
01549     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
01550     return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
01551   }
01552  
01553   // return
01554   *length = new_length;
01555   *array = new_array;
01556   return FC_SUCCESS;
01557 }
01558 
01559 /**
01560  * \ingroup PrivateSimpleDataObjects
01561  * \brief Lookup int in the sorted int array.
01562  *
01563  * \description
01564  *
01565  *    Look for an int in a sorted int array. A flag for whether the int
01566  *    is found is returned in foundInt (1 = found, 0 = not found). The index
01567  *    that the int is at (or would be at if it was in the array) is returned
01568  *    in idx.
01569  *
01570  *    This is implemented as binary search and should have average run
01571  *    time of O(log(sia->numVal)).
01572  *
01573  * \modifications
01574  *    - 06/06/06 ACG Created.
01575  *    - 07/13/06 WSD Separated binary search into it's own routine.
01576  */
01577 FC_ReturnCode _fc_lookupIntInSortedIntArray(
01578   FC_SortedIntArray *sia,  /**< input - sortedIntArray */
01579   int i,                   /**< input - int to lookup */    
01580   int* foundInt,           /**< output - 1 if find int, or 0 */
01581   int* idx                 /**< output - the index if int is found, or
01582                      the index the int would have been at */
01583 ){
01584   int low, high, mid;
01585 
01586   // default returns
01587   if (foundInt)
01588     *foundInt = -1;
01589   if (idx)
01590     *idx = -1;
01591 
01592   // check arguments
01593   if (!fc_isSortedIntArrayValid(sia) || !foundInt || !idx) {
01594     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
01595   }
01596 
01597   // early return
01598   if (sia->numVal < 1) {
01599     *foundInt = 0;
01600     *idx = 0;
01601     return FC_SUCCESS;
01602   }
01603 
01604   // binary search
01605   low = 0;
01606   high = sia->numVal-1;
01607   while (low <= high) {
01608     mid = (low+high)/2;
01609     if (i == sia->vals[mid]) {
01610       *foundInt = 1;
01611       *idx = mid;
01612       return FC_SUCCESS;
01613     } else if (i < sia->vals[mid]) { // val is before mid
01614       high = mid-1;
01615     } else {
01616       low = mid+1;
01617     }
01618   }
01619 
01620   // no match
01621   *foundInt = 0;
01622   *idx = (i < sia->vals[mid] ? mid : mid+1);
01623   return FC_SUCCESS;
01624 }
01625 
01626 /**
01627  * \ingroup PrivateSimpleDataObjects
01628  * \brief Add entry to a sorted int array at the specified location.
01629  *
01630  * \description
01631  *
01632  *    Use this after you know where to put the new entry (usually
01633  *    use \ref _fc_lookupIntInSortedIntArray).
01634  *
01635  *    NOTE! Make sure that use of this function does not violate the sorted
01636  *    and uniqueness of the sorted int array!
01637  *
01638  * \modifications
01639  *    - 2006/08/04 WSD Created.
01640  *    - 2008/05/02 CDU Updated to support getting unsorted vals back
01641  */
01642 FC_ReturnCode _fc_addEntryToSortedIntArray(
01643   FC_SortedIntArray *sia, /**< input/output - sortedIntArray */
01644   int idx,                /**< input - location to add the value */
01645   int value               /**< input - the value to add */
01646 )
01647 {
01648   FC_ReturnCode rc;
01649 
01650   // check args
01651   if (!fc_isSortedIntArrayValid(sia) || idx < 0 || idx > sia->numVal) {
01652     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
01653     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
01654   }
01655 
01656   // make sure there is room
01657   if (sia->numVal >= sia->maxNumVal){
01658     int tmp;
01659     tmp = sia->maxNumVal;
01660     rc = _fc_expandIntArray(&sia->maxNumVal, &sia->vals);
01661     if(rc!=FC_SUCCESS)
01662       return rc;
01663 
01664     rc = _fc_expandIntArray(&tmp, &sia->tickets);
01665     if(rc!=FC_SUCCESS)
01666       return rc;
01667   }
01668 
01669   // do it
01670   if (idx < sia->numVal) {
01671     memmove(&sia->vals[idx+1],    &sia->vals[idx],    (sia->numVal-idx)*sizeof(int));
01672     memmove(&sia->tickets[idx+1], &sia->tickets[idx], (sia->numVal-idx)*sizeof(int));
01673   }
01674   sia->vals[idx] = value;
01675   sia->tickets[idx] = sia->nextTicket; 
01676   sia->numVal++;
01677   sia->nextTicket++; 
01678   assert(sia->nextTicket > sia->tickets[idx]); //Look for overflow
01679 
01680   return FC_SUCCESS;
01681 }
01682 
01683 /**
01684  * \ingroup PrivateSimpleDataObjects
01685  * \brief Remove an entry at a specified location from a sorted int array.
01686  *
01687  * \description
01688  *
01689  *    Use this after you know which entry you want to delete (usually
01690  *    use \ref _fc_lookupIntInSortedIntArray).
01691  *
01692  *    This routine will fail if you try to delete an entry from an empty 
01693  *    array.
01694  *
01695  * \modifications
01696  *    - 08/04/06 WSD Created.
01697  */
01698 FC_ReturnCode _fc_deleteEntryFromSortedIntArray(
01699   FC_SortedIntArray *sia, /**< input/output - sortedIntArray */
01700   int idx                 /**< input - location to remove value */
01701 )
01702 {
01703   // check args
01704   if (!fc_isSortedIntArrayValid(sia) || idx < 0 || idx > sia->numVal-1) {
01705     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
01706     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
01707   }
01708   
01709   // do it
01710   if (idx+1 < sia->numVal) {
01711     memmove(&sia->vals[idx],              &sia->vals[idx+1],              (sia->numVal-(idx+1))*sizeof(int));
01712     memmove(&sia->tickets[idx], &sia->tickets[idx+1], (sia->numVal-(idx+1))*sizeof(int));
01713   }
01714   sia->numVal--;
01715   
01716   return FC_SUCCESS;
01717 }

01719 /**
01720  * \ingroup PrivateSimpleDataObjects
01721  * \brief Expand a blob array.
01722  *
01723  * \description
01724  *
01725  *    If length == 0, an array of length 1 is generated.
01726  *    If length > 0, then the array length is doubled. If length < 0,
01727  *    an error is generated.
01728  *
01729  * \modifications
01730  *    - 08/07/06 WSD Created.
01731  */
01732 FC_ReturnCode _fc_expandBlobArray(
01733   int* length,   /**< input/output - length of the array */
01734   void*** array  /**< input/output - the array */
01735 ){
01736   int new_length;
01737   void** new_array;
01738 
01739   // test args (note, array doesn't have to be null if length = 0)
01740   if (!length || *length < 0 || !array) 
01741     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
01742 
01743   // do it
01744   new_length = *length > 0 ? 2*(*length) : 1;
01745   if (*length == 0)  // malloc in case they didn't pass in NULL
01746     new_array = malloc(new_length*sizeof(void*));
01747   else 
01748     new_array = realloc(*array, new_length*sizeof(void*));
01749   if (!new_array) {
01750     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
01751     return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
01752   }
01753  
01754   // return
01755   *length = new_length;
01756   *array = new_array;
01757   return FC_SUCCESS;
01758 }
01759 
01760 /**
01761  * \ingroup PrivateSimpleDataObjects
01762  * \brief Lookup blob in the sorted blob array.
01763  *
01764  * \description
01765  *
01766  *    Look for an blob in a sorted blob array using the provided compare
01767  *    function. A flag for whether a matching blob is found is returned in
01768  *    foundBlob (1 = found, 0 = not found). The index that the int is at (or
01769  *    would be at if it was in the array) is returned in idx.
01770  *
01771  *    This is implemented as binary search and should have average run
01772  *    time of O(log(sia->numVal)).
01773  *
01774  * \modifications
01775  *    - 06/06/06 ACG Created.
01776  *    - 07/13/06 WSD Separated binary search into it's own routine.
01777  */
01778 FC_ReturnCode _fc_lookupBlobInSortedBlobArray(
01779   FC_SortedBlobArray *sba,  /**< input - sortedIntArray */
01780   void* blob,               /**< input - blob to lookup */
01781   int blobCmp(const void* blob1, const void* blob2), /**< input - the
01782                                      compare function */
01783   int* foundBlob,           /**< output - 1 if find blob, or 0 */
01784   int* idx                  /**< output - the index if blob is found, or
01785                       the index the blob would have been at */
01786 ){
01787   int low, high, mid, cmpVal;
01788 
01789   // default returns
01790   if (foundBlob)
01791     *foundBlob = -1;
01792   if (idx)
01793     *idx = -1;
01794 
01795   // check arguments
01796   //?FIX could blob be null?
01797   if (!fc_isSortedBlobArrayValid(sba) || !blob || !blobCmp || !foundBlob ||
01798       !idx) {
01799     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
01800   }
01801 
01802   // early return
01803   if (sba->numBlob < 1) {
01804     *foundBlob = 0;
01805     *idx = 0;
01806     return FC_SUCCESS;
01807   }
01808 
01809   // binary search
01810   low = 0;
01811   high = sba->numBlob-1;
01812   while (low <= high) {
01813     mid = (low+high)/2;
01814     cmpVal = blobCmp((const void*)blob, (const void*)sba->blobs[mid]);
01815     if (cmpVal == 0) {
01816       *foundBlob = 1;
01817       *idx = mid;
01818       return FC_SUCCESS;
01819     } else if (cmpVal < 0) { // blob is before mid
01820       high = mid-1;
01821     } else {
01822       low = mid+1;
01823     }
01824   }
01825 
01826   // no match
01827   *foundBlob = 0;
01828   *idx = (cmpVal < 0 ? mid : mid+1);
01829   return FC_SUCCESS;
01830 }
01831 
01832 /**
01833  * \ingroup PrivateSimpleDataObjects
01834  * \brief Add entry to a sorted blob array at the specified location.
01835  *
01836  * \description
01837  *
01838  *    Use this after you know where to put the new entry (usually
01839  *    use \ref _fc_lookupBlobInSortedBlobArray).
01840  *
01841  *    NOTE! Make sure that use of this function does not violate the sorted
01842  *    and uniqueness of the sorted blob array!
01843  *
01844  * \modifications
01845  *    - 08/08/06 WSD Created.
01846  */
01847 FC_ReturnCode _fc_addEntryToSortedBlobArray(
01848   FC_SortedBlobArray *sba, /**< input/output - sortedBlobArray */
01849   int idx,                 /**< input - location to add the blob */
01850   void* blob_p             /**< input - the pointer to the blob */
01851 )
01852 {
01853   // check args
01854   if (!fc_isSortedBlobArrayValid(sba) || idx < 0 || idx > sba->numBlob ||
01855       !blob_p) {
01856     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
01857     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
01858   }
01859 
01860   // make sure there is room
01861   if (sba->numBlob >= sba->maxNumBlob)
01862     _fc_expandBlobArray(&sba->maxNumBlob, &sba->blobs);
01863 
01864   // do it
01865   if (idx < sba->numBlob) {
01866     memmove((sba->blobs)+idx+1,(sba->blobs)+idx,
01867          (sba->numBlob-idx)*sizeof(void*));
01868   }
01869   sba->blobs[idx] = blob_p;
01870   sba->numBlob++;
01871 
01872   return FC_SUCCESS;
01873 }
01874 
01875 /**
01876  * \ingroup PrivateSimpleDataObjects
01877  * \brief Remove an entry at a specified location from a sorted blob array.
01878  *
01879  * \description
01880  *
01881  *    Use this after you know which entry you want to delete (usually
01882  *    use \ref _fc_lookupBlobInSortedBlobArray).
01883  *
01884  *    This routine will fail if you try to delete an entry from an empty 
01885  *    array.
01886  *
01887  * \modifications
01888  *    - 08/08/06 WSD Created.
01889  */
01890 FC_ReturnCode _fc_deleteEntryFromSortedBlobArray(
01891   FC_SortedBlobArray *sba, /**< input/output - sortedBlobArray */
01892   int idx                  /**< input - location to remove value */
01893 )
01894 {
01895   // check args
01896   if (!fc_isSortedBlobArrayValid(sba) || idx < 0 || idx > sba->numBlob-1) {
01897     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
01898     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
01899   }
01900   
01901   // do it
01902   if (idx+1 < sba->numBlob) {
01903     memmove((sba->blobs)+idx,(sba->blobs)+idx+1,
01904          (sba->numBlob-(idx+1))*sizeof(void*));
01905   }
01906   sba->numBlob--;
01907   
01908   return FC_SUCCESS;
01909 }
